results.title: Establishment of a large-scale patient-derived high-risk colorectal adenoma organoid biobank for high-throughput and high-content drug screening
results.text_hl: There are also other potential drugs for @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@adenoma@@@ intervention including @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

results.title: Narrative review of the influence of diabetes mellitus and hyperglycemia on colorectal cancer risk and oncological outcomes
results.text_hl: Dysregulation of the @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMP-activated protein kinase@@@ (@GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@) pathway leads to metabolic imbalance and indicates @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ risk. The use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ for chemoprevention has been shown to reduce @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@CRC@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@adenoma@@@ incidence through the upregulation of @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@, which causes cell cycle arrest in the Gap 1-S (G1-S) phase and inhibits the @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@ pathway, even potentially reversing the epithelial-mesenchymal transition.

citations.NLM: Cheng HC, Chang TK, Su WC, Tsai HL, Wang JY. Narrative review of the influence of diabetes mellitus and hyperglycemia on colorectal cancer risk and oncological outcomes Transl Oncol. 2021 Jul;14(7):101089. PMID: 33838541

results.title: Is Metformin Associated with a Lower Prevalence of Polyps, Adenomas, and Colorectal Carcinoma in Patients with Diabetes Mellitus?
results.text_hl: Is @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Associated with a Lower Prevalence of @DISEASE_Polyps @DISEASE_MESH:D011127 @@@Polyps@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@Adenomas@@@, and @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@Colorectal Carcinoma@@@ in Patients with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes Mellitus@@@?

results.title: Metformin for recurrent colorectal polyp or adenoma prevention after polypectomy in patients without diabetes mellitus: a prospective study.
results.text_hl: For the number of recurrent @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@adenomas@@@ per subject, the difference between the control and the high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ groups was significant (0.86+-1.09 vs. 0.47+-0.83, p=0.020).

results.title: Metformin and colorectal cancer: a systematic review, meta-analysis and meta-regression.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: We included 58 studies and summarized incidences of @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@colorectal adenoma and cancer@@@, as well as @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ survival outcomes. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ users had a significant lower incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@colorectal adenoma@@@ (RR 0.77, CI 0.67-0.88, p < 0.001), advanced @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@adenoma@@@ (0.61, CI 0.42-0.88, p = 0.008) and @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@CRC@@@ (RR 0.76, CI 0.69-0.84, p < 0.001) respectively compared with non-@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ users.

citations.NLM: Ng CW, Jiang AA, Toh EMS, Ng CH, Ong ZH, Peng S, Tham HY, Sundar R, Chong CS, Khoo CM. Metformin and colorectal cancer: a systematic review, meta-analysis and meta-regression. Int J Colorectal Dis. 2020 Aug;35(8):1501-1512. PMID: 32592092
citations.BibTeX: @article{32592092, title={Metformin and colorectal cancer: a systematic review, meta-analysis and meta-regression.}, author={Ng CW and Jiang AA and Toh EMS and Ng CH and Ong ZH and Peng S and Tham HY and Sundar R and Chong CS and Khoo CM}, journal={Int J Colorectal Dis}, volume={35}, number={8}, pages={1501-1512}}

results.title: The efficacy of chemopreventive agents on the incidence of colorectal adenomas: A systematic review and network meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Of 20,925 included @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, 7766 had an @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@adenoma@@@. Compared to placebo, the combination of @CHEMICAL_Eflornithine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000518 @@@difluoromethylornithine@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Eflornithine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000518 @@@DFMO@@@) + @CHEMICAL_Sulindac @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013467 @@@Sulindac@@@ (RR 0.24, CrI 0.10-0.55) demonstrated a protective effect, while @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ had a RR of 0.77 (CrI 0.60-1.00), @CHEMICAL_Celecoxib @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068579 @@@celecoxib@@@ 800 mg had a RR of 0.56 (CrI 0.31-1.01) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ had a RR of 0.56 (CrI 0.22-1.39).

citations.NLM: Heer E, Ruan Y, Mah B, Nguyen T, Lyons H, Poirier A, Boyne DJ, O'Sullivan DE, Heitman SJ, Hilsden RJ, Forbes N, Brenner DR. The efficacy of chemopreventive agents on the incidence of colorectal adenomas: A systematic review and network meta-analysis. Prev Med. 2022 Sep;162():107169. PMID: 35878711

results.title: The Emerging Role of Metformin in the Prevention and Treatment of Colorectal Cancer: A Game Changer for the Management of Colorectal Cancer.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ decreases the risk of new @DISEASE_Polyps @DISEASE_MESH:D011127 @@@polyps@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Adenoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@adenomas@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@.
